intro: Parrya nudicaulis var. stenocarpa, commonly known as the narrow-fruited parrya, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in alpine or subalpine regions. It has a low, mat-forming growth habit with smooth, narrow leaves. Its fruits are small and cylindrical, giving it the common name "narrow-fruited."
